metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14305 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds memory write flaw was found in how the Linux kernelâ€™sVoice Over IP H.323 connection tracking functionality handled connectionson ipv6 port 1720. This flaw allows an unauthenticated remote user to crashthe system, causing a denial of service. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-187-generic - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-lowlatency - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-187-generic - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-187-lowlatency - 4.4.0-187.217
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-kvm - 4.4.0-1078.85
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1112-aws - 4.4.0-1112.124
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-187.217').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.85').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1112.124').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.146').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1141.149').
